program_description: The AmeriCorps Youth Launch (AYL) proposes to have 37 AmeriCorps members who will serve as mentors to provide Search Institute asset-building activities in Clarke, Decatur, Lucas, Ringgold, Union, and Wayne Counties in rural South Central Iowa. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for demonstrating a significant gain in Search Institute Developmental Assets that increase the likelihood of school and life success for 129 at-risk youth. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 460 volunteers who will be engaged in programs and activities that serve youth, families, and communities to help reduce the economic, cultural, and opportunity poverty of the region. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education.

program_name: AmeriCorps State AmeriCorps of Martin County
organization_name: Boys & Girls Clubs of Martin County, Inc.
program_description: The Boys & Girls Clubs of Martin County (BGCMC) proposes to have 65 AmeriCorps members (40 MSY) who will improve educational outcomes for 1275 youth in grades K-8 in Martin County, FL in 5 middle schools and 5 elementary schools.

The program provides direct tutoring services in reading literacy and an academically-based after school program targeted to at-risk students in fifteen district elementary schools in Amarillo, Texas.
The program aims to increase involvement of parents in their children's education and provide children with skills to be deemed ready for school in 11 Texas communities.
The United Way of Dane County (UWDC) proposes to have 18 AmeriCorps members who will tutor High School students in Algebra and Geometry in four high schools in Madison and Middleton, Wisconsin.

Parent Possible proposes to have 50 AmeriCorps members who will deliver the Home Instruction for Parents of Preschool Youngsters (HIPPY) evidence-based, school readiness program to families with children ages 2-5 in Colorado counties of Adams, Alamosa, Arapahoe, Conejos, Costilla, Crowley, Denver, El Paso, Huerfano, Larimer, Las Animas, Mesa, Mineral, Otero, Pueblo, Rio Grande, Saguache, and Weld). At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for ensuring 366 children demonstrate gains in literacy skills. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 21 volunteers who will be engaged in supporting monthly group meetings.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Communities In Schools of Central Texas
organization_name: Communities in Schools of Central Texas
program_description: The AmeriCorps members will serve as mentors and academic supporters in public schools in four Central Texas counties, aiming to help 700 students have increased social and emotional outcomes.

program_name: AmeriCorps State College Forward Partnership for Higher Education
program_description: College Possible proposes to have 67 AmeriCorps members who will provide intensive coaching to economically disadvantaged high school and/or college students in the Austin, Texas area.

The program proposes to have 77.09 MSY AmeriCorps members (90 full-time, 25 three-quarter time, and 6 half-time) who will be trained and coached by literacy experts to extend the instructional capacity of K-3rd grade classrooms in 25 cities across Michigan. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for supporting 2,033 K-3 students at an estimated 60 K-3 sites to accelerate literacy growth and proficiency rates.
The Alpine Achievers Initiative Positive Youth Development program proposes to have 31 AmeriCorps members who will provide positive youth development programming in rural Colorado.

program_name: AmeriCorps, Monterey County United for Literacy
program_description: The Monterey County Office of Education proposes to have 43 AmeriCorps members who will provide literacy tutoring in the Alisal Union School District, Chualar Union School District, King City Union School District, and Monterey Peninsula Unified School District of Monterey County. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for improving reading skills by at least 1-grade level for 250 K-4th graders. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage an additional 5 volunteers who will be engaged in on-going literacy activities and 75 one-time event-based volunteers. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education. The CNCS investment of $651,965 will be matched with $711,200 in public funding.

The ABC AmeriCorps of Sauk Valley Community College proposes to have 35 AmeriCorps members who will tutor economically disadvantaged students and provide other classroom support in grade schools, provide homework help and offer educational activities in out-of-school time during the school year and provide summer education programs for kids. In addition, member will provide job search coaching and GED support services to economically disadvantaged individuals. Members will also provide service to increase organizational capacity through volunteer management and other capacity building efforts that support rural non-profit and school-based organizations in Lee, Whiteside, Carroll, Bureau, and Henry Counties. In addition, members will provide support to agencies with critical needs that do not have the capacity to write their own AmeriCorps grant.

The City of Orlando proposes to have 20 full-time and 20 three-quarter time AmeriCorps members who will provide in-school and out-of-school tutoring and mentoring services to low-performing and at-risk youth at five (5) Orlando public middle schools and five (5) after-school and summer middle school program sites.

program_name: AmeriCorps State NCCAP AmeriCorps Team - Greater Wausau Area
organization_name: North Central Community Action Program Inc.
program_description: The program proposes to have 31 AmeriCorps members who will tutor and mentor elementary, middle and senior high school students in the Wausau, Antigo, Merrill & Wisconsin Rapids school districts. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for tutoring and mentoring 350 targeted students identified by the districts due to economic disadvantage, English language ability, and credit deficiency.

The Arizona College Access Network (AzCAN), a program of College Success Arizona, proposes to have 50 AmeriCorps members who will prepare over 2,500 low-income, first-generation, and students of color for success in postsecondary education through college access programming in low income, Title 1 designated high schools across Arizona, specifically Tucson, Phoenix and Flagstaff as well as rural areas such as Yuma, Pinal, Cochise, Gila, Mohave, and Graham County. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for helping students demonstrate increased preparation for postsecondary education through college admission and enrollment. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 250 volunteers who will be engaged in statewide initiatives and service projects that support and improve the Arizona community. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education.

The NACA Inspired Schools Network (NISN) proposes to have 20 AmeriCorps members who will support students in the classroom and out-of-school-time programming as activity leaders in seven schools in New Mexico including: Native American Community Academy (NACA) in Albuquerque; Dream Diné Charter School in Shiprock; Dzil Dit Looí School of Empowerment and Action (DEAP) in Navajo; Six Directions Indigenous School in Gallup; Kha'p'o Community School in Santa Clara Pueblo; Raices de Saber in Las Cruces; and T'siya Day School in Zia Pueblo. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for promoting improved academic engagement (attitudes) in 285 students at participating schools. AmeriCorps members will also gain exposure to and experience in the education profession and be encouraged and supported in gaining education licensure as appropriate to each member's situation. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Civic Works Service Corps
program_description: The Civic Works Service Corps proposes to have 98 AmeriCorps members who will engage community members in environmental stewardship, tutor high school students and prepare them for college, and repair houses to make them safe for older adults to age in place in Baltimore.

program_name: REACH (Ready to Extend a Caring Hand)
program_description: The REACH program will mentor 30 students at each project school. Members will serve as a caring adult and role model, building strong relationships to uncover student barriers to learning and link students and their families with appropriate school and community resources.

The Community Art Collaborative (CAC) proposes to have 14 Full-Time AmeriCorps Members who will serve economically disadvantaged Baltimore City Public School K-12 youth through after-school, arts-based community programs throughout the city. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps Members will be responsible for improving 200 students' sense of confidence and self-efficacy, through creative expression, skill-building and service learning. In addition, the AmeriCorps Members will leverage an additional 250 volunteers who will be engaged in service-based projects and community-building activities with nonprofit organizations to strengthen economically disadvantaged populations in Baltimore. This program will focus on the AmeriCorps focus area of Education. The AmeriCorps investment of $215,247 will be matched with $395,026 in private funding.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Arizona Serve - Prescott College
program_description: The program ensures students in Yavapai, Pima, and Santa Cruz Counties have the supports to be prepared for school, stay engaged in school, and are ready for college enrollment.

program_name: AmeriCorps Y.O.U.th Serve Evanston and Skokie
program_description: Deliver high-quality afterschool and summer learning programs in 10 elementary and middle/junior high schools in Evanston, Morton Grove, and Skokie, Illinois.

The program proposes to have 86 AmeriCorps members who will serve as reading tutors for K-3rd grade students with reading levels between the 15th and 40th percentile in approximately 20 elementary schools across Mississippi.

program_name: AmeriCorps State College Advising Corps - Boston University
program_description: The College Advising Corps-Boston University proposes to have 36 AmeriCorps members who will provide college advising to economically disadvantaged, first-generation, and underrepresented students in underserved high schools in Boston, Lynn, Malden and Somerville. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for increasing the college enrollment and persistence rates among economically disadvantaged youth at the schools served.

program_name: AmeriCorps State RAI Reading Intervention Program
program_description: The Reading Assist Intervention (RAI) Corps proposes to have 33 AmeriCorps Members who will provide intensive one-to-one structured literacy interventions to 200 students with language-based learning disabilities and/or severe reading challenges in 12 schools across Delaware. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps Members will be responsible for improving student academic performance in reading and enhancing their academic engagement skills.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Colorado Reading Corps - Cost Reimbursement
program_description: The program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education. The CNCS investment of $1,007,754 will be matched with $972,680 -- $600,000 in public funding and $372,680 in private funding.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Massachusetts Promise Fellowship Program
program_description: The Massachusetts Promise Fellowship (MPF) proposes to have 40 AmeriCorps members who will lead Out-of-School Time (OST) programs focused on dropout prevention and on-time graduation through academic enrichment or college and career exploration programming for 6th-12th grade students from economically disadvantaged environments across Massachusetts.

Our House proposes to have 38 members (15.5MSY) who will provide job placement services, ongoing job support, and other services to adults. The AmeriCorps Members will be responsible for helping 450 adults find full-time jobs. In addition, the AmeriCorps Members will leverage an additional 500 volunteers who will be engaged in tutoring, one-on-one household budget advising, and other activities to broaden and deepen services to clients.

The Summer Learning Collaborative proposes to have 40 AmeriCorps members who will lead literacy intervention sessions in community-based agencies throughout Delaware. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for driving improved academic performance in participants. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 20 volunteers who will be engaged in supporting the intervention as teaching assistants.

program_name: AmeriCorps State North Dakota Reading and Math Corps
program_description: The South East Education Cooperative proposes to have 82 AmeriCorps members provide services and support to deliver a proven academic intervention model to students in North Dakota. At the end of the first program year, AmeriCorps members will help over 1,100 students Kindergarten through grade 8 be on-track to read proficiently by third grade and algebra-ready by eighth grade. In addition, AmeriCorps members will leverage 30 community volunteers, who will be engaged in enrichment for students and families. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education. The CNCS investment of $498,269 will be matched with $356,759 in public funding and $163,469 in private funding.

The Match Foundation, Inc., in partnership with Match Charter Public School and the Match Corps Program proposes to have 30 AmeriCorps members who will provide high-dosage, small group, relationship-based Math tutoring to students in Boston, Massachusetts. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for increasing student performance in Mathematics, improving educational outcomes for economically disadvantaged children, and preparing economically disadvantaged students for success in post-secondary educational institutions.

program_name: AmeriCorps State City Year Kansas City
program_description: City Year Kansas City proposes to have 68 full-time AmeriCorps members who will provide full-day education services to students in seven public schools in Kansas City, Missouri. At the end of the first program year, as Student Success Coaches, the AmeriCorps members will provide social-emotional and academic supports to 727 students, of which, 237 will report increased school engagement, 65 will improve literacy skills, and, 81 will improve math skills. Members will also provide extended day and school climate activities. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 275 volunteers who will be engaged in physical service projects on national service days. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education. The CNCS investment of $1,442,333 will be matched $1,442,333, $746,467 in public funding and $695,866 in private funding.

The Purdy AmeriCorps Reading Coach Program proposes to have 11 AmeriCorps Members who will provide literacy-based tutoring to kindergarten through 5th grade students in Purdy Missouri. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps Members will be responsible for improved reading scores in their student beneficiaries. In addition, the AmeriCorps Members will leverage 27 volunteers who will be engaged in various school and community service projects.

Emmanuel Family & Child Development Center proposes to have 20 AmeriCorps members who will help promote school readiness by providing specialized educational support, trauma-informed counseling and speech therapy in central Kansas City, Missouri. At the end of this program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for serving at least 80 children with school-readiness tutoring, speech therapy and clinical counseling. AmeriCorps members will leverage at least 25 volunteers who will be engaged in supporting Emmanuel service projects. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education.

program_name: AmeriCorps State City Year San Antonio
program_description: The program provides full-day education services to students in nine public schools in San Antonio, Texas. AmeriCorps members will provide academic and youth development mentoring to 1,056 students, with a focus on improving literacy and math skills and developing social-emotional skills. Members will also provide extended day and school climate activities, and leverage 140 volunteers.
The program proposes to have 64 AmeriCorps members who will develop and rehabilitate housing units and provide educational services in Spokane, WA.
The Spokane Service Team is an AmeriCorps program that provides safe and affordable housing opportunities in the Spokane area.

The program provides direct tutoring services in reading literacy and an academically-based after school program targeted to at-risk students in seventeen district elementary schools in Amarillo, Texas.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Reading & Math Corps - Southern MN
program_description: The AmeriCorps members will help 2,720 PreK students to develop early learning skills for Kindergarten, and for supporting 9,000 K-3 students to accelerate literacy and math skills and proficiency rates. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 50 volunteers who will be engaged in education enrichment for students and families.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Child Abuse Prevention Association (CAPA)
program_description: The Child Abuse Prevention Association (CAPA) proposes to have 31 AmeriCorps Members who will provide access to preventative mental health services in the form of trauma-focused counseling, clinical case management, and community education in the Kansas City, MO metro area.

College Possible proposes to have 42 AmeriCorps members who will support students from low-income backgrounds for success in post-secondary education through academic and college preparation programming in Milwaukee, WI, and surrounding areas. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for helping students demonstrate improved academic performance in literacy and math, as well as increased preparation for higher education and careers through college admission and persistence. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 100 volunteers who will be engaged in service projects that support the community in which our members serve.

College Possible proposes to have 75 AmeriCorps members who will support 5,420 students from low-income backgrounds for success in post-secondary education through academic and college preparation programming based in St. Paul, Minnesota, and surrounding areas. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for helping students demonstrate increased preparation for higher education and careers through college admission and persistence. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 25 volunteers who will be engaged in service projects that support their community.

The AmeriCorps Youth Launch (AYL) proposes to have 37 AmeriCorps members who will serve as mentors to provide Search Institute asset-building activities in Clarke, Decatur, Lucas, Ringgold, Union, and Wayne Counties in rural South Central Iowa. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for demonstrating a significant gain in Search Institute Developmental Assets that increase the likelihood of school and life success for 129 at-risk youth. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 460 volunteers who will be engaged in programs and activities that serve youth, families, and communities to help reduce the economic, cultural, and opportunity poverty of the region. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education.

The program will teach low-income students and students who are Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) during the summer portion of the college preparatory program for grades 7-9 in the Twin Cities metro.

The Vermont Youth Conservation Corps (VYCC) proposes to have 80 AmeriCorps members who will engage in hands-on service projects, including growing and distributing fresh, nutritious produce and poultry, as well as building trails, improving habitat, and enhancing recreation infrastructure; both food security and environmental stewardships projects will take place in locations throughout Vermont. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for reducing food insecurity and increasing health knowledge for 1035 individuals per year as well as improving 12 acres of public lands and 45 miles of trail and river. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage an average of 400 volunteers per year who will be engaged in growing, harvesting, and distributing vegetables, as well as helping to provide food and nutrition education, for food-insecure individuals and families. This program will focus on the AmeriCorps focus areas of Healthy Futures and Environmental Stewardship.

The AmeriCorps Partners in Learning (APIL) program proposes to have 43 AmeriCorps members who will tutor K-3rd grade struggling readers one on one or in small groups in the Dubuque Community School District's elementary schools and summer programs. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for increasing the reading scores of 250 students with literacy needs. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage an additional 100 volunteers who will be engaged in Dubuque community days of service.

The AmeriCorps State Recovery Corps proposes to have 100 AmeriCorps members who will provide peer support and recovery coaching to individuals working to overcome opioid use disorder and other substance use disorders in Minnesota.

organization_name: ReSOURCE: A Nonprofit Community Enterprise, Inc.
program_description: The Every Body Works AmeriCorps program provides hands-on service learning experience in a real-life workplace setting to reduce barriers, build new skills and confidence, and support self-advocacy while striving to remove bias against those with disabilities.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Vermont Youth Development Corps
program_description: The Washington County Youth Service Bureau/Boys & Girls Club proposes to have 28 AmeriCorps members who will lead youth engagement, learning, and prevention activities in VT. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for reducing opioid misuse risk factors, undoing COVID-19 effects on youth, and fostering healthy outcomes for youth. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 200 volunteers who will be engaged in member-led initiatives. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area(s) of Healthy Futures.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Iowa Legal Aid AmeriCorps Project
program_description: The program will provide direct services to low-income and elderly clients, helping them access legal information, resources, and support needed to resolve civil legal problems impacting their basic needs and fundamental obligations in Iowa's 99 counties.

The Texas HIPPYCorps at the University of North Texas proposes to have 110 AmeriCorps members who will increase involvement of parents in their children's education and provide children with skills to be deemed ready for school in Amarillo, Corpus Christi, Dallas, Houston, Irving, Longview, Odessa, Richardson, Rio Grande Valley, San Antonio, and Wichita Falls.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Communities In Schools of Central Texas
organization_name: Communities in Schools of Central Texas
program_description: The program will have 90 AmeriCorps members who will serve as mentors and academic supporters in public schools in four Central Texas counties. At the end of the program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for 650 students having increased social and emotional outcomes.

program_name: AmeriCorps State College Forward Partnership for Higher Education
program_description: College Possible proposes to have 62 AmeriCorps members who will provide intensive coaching to economically disadvantaged high school and/or college students in the Austin, Texas area.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Lift As You Climb Program - MentorCorps
organization_name: The Curators of the University of Missouri
program_description: The University of Missouri-Kansas City proposes to have 5.0 AmeriCorps Member Service Years to increase college-going and persistence in Kansas City, Missouri. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for increasing the fall-to-fall retention rates for students of Color at UMKC. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 50 additional volunteers who will be engaged in near-peer mentoring and success coaching to Black/African American and Hispanic/Latinx college students, transitioning high school students, and community-engaged learning. This program will focus on the CNCS focus areas of Education and Economic Opportunity and in the priority area of programs that actively engage in removing structural racial inequities, advancing racial equality.

program_name: AmeriCorps State St. Louis Black Repertory Company Community Arts Fellowship
program_description: The St Louis Black Repertory Company proposes to have Six (6) full-time AmeriCorps Members who will provide both in-school and out-of-school interactive learning intervention programs for students in grades K-12 to address the significant academic and non-academic risk factors that affect graduation rates in the St. Louis metro area schools by building critical non-cognitive skills and creating positive social-emotional interactions for students to prepare them for future school success.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Missouri College Advising Corps
program_description: The Missouri College Advising Corps (MCAC) proposes to have 48 AmeriCorps members who will provide college and career advisement services to low-income, underrepresented students in 48 partner high schools within 32 school districts across Missouri. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for providing individualized college advisement to high school seniors with the ultimate goal of increasing college-going rates in partner schools compared to a three-year average baseline. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 240 volunteers who will be engaged in activities that foster a college-going culture within partner high schools.

program_name: Habitat for Humanity of Iowa AmeriCorps Program
organization_name: Habitat for Humanity of Iowa, Inc.
program_description: The Habitat for Humanity of Iowa AmeriCorps Program proposes to have 36 AmeriCorps members who will develop affordable housing across the state of Iowa, and who will stabilize and repair homes after a natural disaster. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for construction and repair of 100 housing units. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 2,500 volunteers who will be engaged in building or repairing safe, healthy affordable housing.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Healing Action Network, INC.
program_description: The Healing Action Network, INC., (HAN) proposes to have 9 AmeriCorps Members who will provide access to preventative mental health services to survivors of commercial sexual exploitation in the St. Louis region through case management, opioid education and Naloxone distribution, therapeutic counseling and providing community education to individuals and organizations across Missouri. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps Members will be responsible for increasing knowledge regarding opioid education to program participants, assisting program recipients in achieving progress in at least one recovery goal, and increasing the knowledge/skill of community members and organizations across Missouri. In addition, the AmeriCorps Members will leverage 42 volunteers who will be engaged in community service projects.

The Duluth Area Family YMCA's True North AmeriCorps program proposes to have 64 AmeriCorps members who will provide social and emotional learning and academic enrichment to 1,000 children identified as 'at risk' in grades K-5 in 40 afterschool and school-based sites in Duluth, MN and surrounding rural counties (St Louis, Lake, Cook County, MN). At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for improving students' social and emotional skills with 700 (70%) students demonstrating improvement. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 200 volunteers who will be engaged in supporting enrichment programming.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Kansas City Teacher Residency II
program_description: The Kansas City Teacher Residency proposes to have 28 AmeriCorps Members who will serve as classroom support and co-teachers in public school districts and public charter schools. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps Members will be responsible for increasing the academic outcomes for students in partnership with their co-teacher. In addition, the AmeriCorps Members will leverage 360 volunteers who will be engaged in member training and supporting classrooms where members are serving.

program_name: AmeriCorps State International Institute of St. Louis AmeriCorps Program
organization_name: International Institute of Metropolitan St. Louis
program_description: The program will help refugees rebuild their lives, integrate into their new communities and become self-sufficient as soon as possible in the greater St. Louis Metropolitan area.

The Missouri Reading Corps program proposes to have 60 AmeriCorps members who will provide children pre-K to grade 3 with daily, targeted early literacy intervention in pre-K classrooms and elementary schools in the greater Kansas City and St. Louis, Missouri, areas.

program_name: RELIEF: Recovering from Covid-19 through Education, Local partnerships, Interdisciplinary Efforts, and Food assistance
program_description: The RELIEF program aims to increase food security and healthy living choices among Missouri State University students and employees by providing access to healthy and culturally diverse foods and nutrition education.

The Kansas City Public Library proposes to have 10 AmeriCorps Members who will serve as DigitalCorps members who will provide direct service for adult digital inclusion learners in Jackson County, Missouri.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Bur Oak Land Trust AmeriCorps
program_description: The Bur Oak Land Trust proposes to have 11 AmeriCorps members who will provide active land management, environmental education and disaster response services primarily in Eastern Iowa. At the end of the first program year, the 7 Environmental Stewardship AmeriCorps members will be responsible for improving at least 420 acres of land. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 200 volunteers who will be engaged in environmental stewardship and conservation education.

program_name: AmeriCorps State City of Davenport AmeriCorps/Youth Corps Program
program_description: The City of Davenport proposes to have 67 AmeriCorps members who will perform service activities such as attendance support, academic support, mentoring support and recruitment, community outreach, interactive educational programs and other educational support activities at Big Brothers Big Sisters, Davenport Community Schools, Stepping Stones, Davenport Parks and Recreation, Davenport Library, Girl Scouts, The Putnam Museum and other organizations focusing on educational experiences. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for helping to raise the attendance rates, job readiness, and reading proficiency, and decreasing the high-risk behaviors for Davenport community schools students. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage an additional 200 volunteers who will be engaged in supporting educational mentoring activities with youth.

The University of Northern Iowa proposes to have 114 members who will provide direct energy efficiency services, environmental education, volunteer engagement opportunities, and engage in member professional development experiences throughout Iowa.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Iowa Reading Corps AmeriCorps Program
program_description: The United Ways of Iowa proposes to have 65 AmeriCorps members who will serve as Iowa Reading Corps AmeriCorps members tutoring students in K-3rd grade who are at risk of reading failure in the state of Iowa. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for delivering interventions that improve literacy skills and related academic performance. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 130 volunteers who will be engaged in 1-time and ongoing literacy activities.

The program will have 55 AmeriCorps members serve as Student Leaders, Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) Associates and College Coaches in 10-15 partner high schools, the ICA office, and 15 colleges. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for ensuring 249 students served by the Access and Success program complete the necessary steps to enter and complete post-secondary education.

College Bound Saint Louis (CB) proposes to have 14 full-time AmeriCorps Members (ACMs) who will prepare students for college and career success through developmental opportunities, educational content, and coaching designed to foster academic and personal success in Saint Louis at the main College Bound office and at our embedded office at Saint Louis Community College-Forrest Park. We will also provide early college awareness programming for 300 ninth-grade students in St. Louis, MO.

program_name: AmeriCorps State United Way of the Midlands
organization_name: United Way of the Midlands Inc
program_description: The Midlands Reading Consortium serves students in Richland, Lexington, Orangeburg, Fairfield, and Newberry counties. AmeriCorps Members would serve prekindergarten to second grade students in one-to-one reading engagement sessions, engage parents about the importance of reading at home, increase home libraries through book distribution, and promote literacy through general outreach and community engagement.

The Minneapolis Public Schools' City of Lakes program proposes to have 35 AmeriCorps members who will provide evidence-informed tutoring, enrichment, and parent engagement to 200 Long-Term English Learners in grades 6-8 in ten school locations throughout Minneapolis Public Schools.

The Minnesota Pollution Control Agency proposes to have 48 AmeriCorps members who will help improve environmental stewardship by implementing locally-defined projects in host communities across the state.

Equal Heart proposes to have 287 AmeriCorps members who will provide a multitude of services; including job readiness services, student engagement, environmental treatment, hunger reduction, connections to service opportunities, and other services that meet local needs in rural, distressed and other under-resourced communities across Texas.
focus_area: Economic Opportunity, Education, Environmental Stewardship, Healthy Futures, and Veterans and Military Families

program_description: The Southern Minnesota Initiative Foundation (SMIF) proposes to have 20 full-time AmeriCorps members in its Learning Early Achieves Potential (LEAP) Initiative who will be trained to provide targeted intervention 1:1 and small group instruction, large group education in teachable classroom moments on social emotional learning (SEL) school readiness skills to assist economically disadvantaged preschoolers in 16 early childhood programs across Southern Minnesota.
AmeriCorps State Lead For Minnesota - Hometown Fellows

College Possible proposes to have 30 AmeriCorps members who will support 2,018 students from low-income backgrounds for success in post-secondary education through academic and college preparation programming in Douglas, Sarpy, Lancaster, Buffalo, Wayne, Nemaha, Saline, and Dodge Counties in Nebraska.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Iowa AmeriCorps 4H Outreach Program
organization_name: Iowa State University of Science and Technology
program_description: The Iowa State University AmeriCorps 4-H program proposes to have 45 AmeriCorps members who will provide positive youth development activities through a combination of in-school, after-school, and out-of-school programming in 30 sites that have a high concentration of youth who are economically disadvantaged, reside in rural areas, and/or have special/exceptional needs, all of which represent characteristics that have been disproportionally impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. At the end of the first program year, the members will be responsible for increasing knowledge in at least one of four 4-H life skill development areas for youth participants. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 300 volunteers to support activities associated with positive youth development.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Austin Achieve Public Schools
program_description: The Austin Achieve Public Schools (AAPS) proposes to have 20 AmeriCorps members who will serve as reading specialists for AAPS Elementary and Middle School students in Austin, Texas. At the end of the program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for improved reading skills among AAPS students as evidenced by performance on Fountas & Pinnell Leveled Literacy Intervention tests.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Mental Health America of Greenville County
organization_name: Mental Health America of Greenville County
program_description: The program will consist of 21 AmeriCorps Members who will work on the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline in all SC counties. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps Members will be responsible for responding to 3,000 calls from the National Suicide prevention Lifeline.

organization_name: United Way of Horry County Inc
program_description: The AmeriCorps SC planning grant will provide resources and guidance to design a high-quality AmeriCorps program that will seek to utilize AmeriCorps Members to address the critical education issues in Horry County. During the planning period, the organization will work with the recently formed Horry County Birth to 5 Coalition to identify the target communities, develop a plan to deliver a science-based solution, establish effective partners, and design an AmeriCorps member and volunteer recruitment plan.

program_name: AmeriCorps State City of Dubuque AmeriCorps Program
program_description: The City of Dubuque proposes to have 16 AmeriCorps members who will develop and implement teen programming in Dubuque, IA. At the end of the program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for a change in teenaged youths' knowledge of social-emotional skills and knowledge of career opportunities. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 100 volunteers who will be engaged in mentoring teens and supporting teen programming.

program_name: AmeriCorps State NWF - AmeriCorps Georgia Planning Grant
program_description: The National Wildlife Federation proposes to develop an AmeriCorps program serving in Georgia that will focus on the CNCS or Georgia Services focus area(s) of Environmental Stewardship. The CNCS investment of $75,000 will be matched with $[32,935], $[0] in public funding and $[32,935] in private funding. No AmeriCorps members will be needed to execute this plan.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Reading Corps and Math Corps - Mississippi
program_description: The program will provide 30 AmeriCorps members to help schools deliver proven academic interventions to economically disadvantaged students at schools in Mississippi, specifically, Jackson Public School District. The AmeriCorps members will be responsible for helping 630 students kindergarten to grade 8 be on-track to read proficiently by third grade, and algebra-ready by eighth grade.

The Imagine Art AmeriCorps Program proposes to have 20 FT AmeriCorps members who will serve in training and direct service roles supporting job readiness for artists with disabilities in Austin, Texas. At the end of the program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for increasing knowledge, skills and opportunities that impact job readiness and employment outcomes for 50 artists with disabilities. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 50 volunteers who will be engaged in supporting member activities.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Virginia College Advising Corps
organization_name: Rector & Visitors of the University of Virginia
program_description: The Virginia College Advising Corps proposes to have 60 AmeriCorps members who will provide near-peer college advising to low-income, underrepresented, and first-generation students in 66 high school site locations.

The Travis County CAPITAL AmeriCorps Project proposes to have 35 AmeriCorps members who will lead out-of-school time (afterschool, summer camp, and outreach events) and in-school STEM enrichment experiences in Travis County elementary and middle schools in which the majority of students qualify for free or reduced price lunch. At the end of the program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for improving academic engagement in 375 students. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 16 volunteers who will be engaged in providing additional STEM enrichment experiences.

The Palmetto Conservation Foundation (PCF) proposes to have 24 AmeriCorps members who expand green infrastructure, support environmental stewardship efforts, and participate in disaster preparedness, relief, and recovery across South Carolina.

organization_name: Carroll County Schools, Smyth County Schools, and Galax City Schools
program_description: The LIFT UP AmeriCorps Tutoring program proposes to have 38 half-time AmeriCorps members who will tutor at-risk students in reading and/or math in Pre-K through 8th grade in 9 schools in Carroll County and in 1 middle school in Smyth County and 1 elementary school in the City of Galax. At the end of the program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for at least 60% of the identified at-risk students in Pre-K through 8th grade to reach the end-of-year/course benchmark on the state required benchmark test for their grade level.

The City of Richmond proposes to have 19 AmeriCorps members who will provide opioid and heroin abuse direct prevention and recovery services, economic opportunities for underserved citizens, and environmental stewardship for at-risk ecosystems that include parks/ public spaces, trails, and rivers in Richmond, Virginia.
focus_area: Healthy Futures, Economic Opportunities, Environmental Stewardship

organization_name: Virginia Department of Conservation and Recreation
program_description: The Virginia Service and Conservation Corps proposes to have 80 AmeriCorps members who will focus on invasive species removal, trail maintenance and construction, and environmental education throughout Virginia.

The Literacy Lab proposes to have 70 AmeriCorps members who will provide daily, targeted early literacy interventions to kindergarten through 3rd grade students in elementary schools in the Greater Richmond, Hampton Roads, and Dan River regions of Virginia.

AmeriCorps members will provide a critical link across the three main aspects of a child's daily experience (school, afterschool, home/community) to improve the academic performance of 80 third-fifth grade and Middle School students from historically underserved communities in Arlington, VA.

program_name: Washington Association of Child Advocate Programs
organization_name: Washington Association of Child Advocate Programs
program_description: The Washington Association of Child Advocate Programs proposes to have 20 AmeriCorps members who will assist in the recruitment of volunteer guardians ad litem to serve dependent children in various jurisdictions and tribes throughout Washington state. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for supporting and implementing local volunteer program recruitment strategies and the volunteer on-boarding process. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 400 volunteers who will be engaged in serving dependent children as a guardian ad litem.

program_name: Washington Association of Child Advocate Programs
organization_name: Washington Association of Child Advocate Programs
program_description: This year we continued to see programs struggle with recruitment and saw significant program staff turnover which also impacted recruitment and retention of members. That said the number of applicants reported are comparable to applications received in PY18. Subgrantees continue to cite high cost of living, mental health needs, and partner organization capacity as barriers to recruitment. In response ServeWA has worked to increase federal cost per MSY in alignment with agency strategies, obtain additional state money to support standard benefits such as member EAPs, and subsidizing host site fees for organizations new to AmeriCorps or in underserved or underinvested areas. Additionally, Serve Washington has a Recruitment and Engagement Manager and has increased commission led member development opportunities.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Girl Scouts of Western Washington AmeriCorps Grant
program_description: The mission of Girl Scouts of Western Washington (GSWW) is to build girls of courage, confidence, and character who make the world a better place. Our community represents every race, ethnicity, income level, sexual orientation, ability, and religion; reflects a spectrum of gender identity; and connects across geographic locations. By focusing our attention on community members who are furthest from racial, economic, and social justice, Girl Scouts can be an instrument of change, promoting equitable outcomes for all. We wholly commit to taking anti-racist action to grow as an anti-racist and anti-oppressive organization so that, through Girl Scouts, our members are affirmed as they strive to make our community and world better.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Port Angeles School District
program_description: The Port Angeles School District proposes to have 16 AmeriCorps members who will serve as mentors and provide academic support in K-12 schools in the Port Angeles School District and with the Lower Elwha Klallam Tribe. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for improving academic and community engagement among students served. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage an additional 85 volunteers who will be engaged in mentoring students and increasing community collaborations. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of Education.
This year we continued to see programs struggle with recruitment and saw significant program staff turnover which also impacted recruitment and retention of members.

Common Threads Farm proposes to have 30 AmeriCorps members who will contribute to the development of a more just and equitable food system by increasing access to opportunities for youth to grow, prepare, eat, learn about and share healthy food in school and community settings in Whatcom County, as well as at partner site locations across WA state. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for having increased children's access to healthy food and having increased their willingness to try new healthy foods. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage 400 volunteers who will be engaged in growing food in school gardens and supporting food education lessons. This program will focus on the CNCS focus area of healthy futures.

program_name: AmeriCorps State Salvation Army NW Division - Planning
program_description: The Salvation Army in WA served over 387,636 individuals by assisting with food boxes, homeless bags, weekend food for school children, supplies, holiday assistance, sending at risk kids to camp, case management services through utilities, rent assistance and the Pathway of Hope Program. The Salvation Army strives to address the needs of the whole person through short-and long-term assistance to address the root issues and break the cycle of intergenerational poverty.

organization_name: UNITED WAY OF BENTON AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES
program_description: The program proposes to have 17 1,200-hour AmeriCorps members who will coordinate and run lunchtime mentoring programs in all 17 middle schools in Benton and Franklin Counties. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for ensuring that a minimum of 15 chronically absent students in each school have received mentoring once a week for 45 minutes during lunchtime for the 2021-2022 school year. AmeriCorps members will do this by recruiting and coordinating at least 15 local volunteers at each school who will be engaged in mentoring chronically absent students.

program_name: Campus Civic Leaders and Engagement Corps
program_description: The Campus Civic Leaders and Engagement Corps will mobilize 254 AmeriCorps members to address critical community issues that were exacerbated by COVID-19 in the areas of Education, Healthy Futures, and Environmental Stewardship.

program_name: Washington Campus Coalition for the Public Good CLEC Program
program_description: The program provides AmeriCorps members to serve in various capacities, including education, health, and economic opportunity initiatives.

organization_name: Washington State Department of Employment Security
program_description: The Washington Service Corps (WSC) proposes to have 450 AmeriCorps members to provide direct services, education/outreach, and project capacity-building in 165 organizations in urban, suburban, and rural areas across Washington.
focus_area: Economic Opportunity, Education, Environmental Stewardship, and Healthy Futures

organization_name: Washington State Department of Employment Security
program_description: The Washington Reading Corps (WRC), a program within the Washington Service Corps statewide intermediary organization, proposes to have 125 full-time AmeriCorps members who will provide: (1) evidence-informed reading tutoring for 2,400 low-income and English Learner (EL) K-4th grade students and/or (2) literacy skills-building activities for 600 low-income and EL preschool children, in approximately 60 high-needs elementary schools and early learning centers across the state. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for achieving the following outcomes: (1) at least 816 K-4 students will demonstrate improved academic performance by exceeding expected average weekly improvement in fluency; (2) at least 204 preschool children will demonstrate improved school readiness by meeting age-appropriate social-emotional and language/literacy benchmarks. In addition, AmeriCorps members will leverage an additional 200 community volunteers who will be engaged in providing the same evidence-informed tutoring and literacy activities for students and children alongside and under the guidance of the AmeriCorps Members.

program_name: AmeriCorps Fixed Amount Grant (State) Vet Corps Washington
organization_name: Washington State Department of Veterans Affairs
program_description: The Washington State Department of Veterans Affairs proposes to have fifty (50) AmeriCorps members who will serve as culturally competent Peer Mentors statewide with varied partners focused on veteran services.

program_name: AmeriCorps Fixed Amount Grant (State) Vet Corps Washington
organization_name: Washington State Department of Veterans Affairs
program_description: The Washington State Department of Veterans Affairs proposes to have fifty (50) AmeriCorps members who will serve as culturally competent Peer Mentors statewide with varied partners focused on veteran services.

The program will have 40 AmeriCorps members who will implement watershed restoration activities designed to increase stormwater retention in order to stem the tide of rain-borne pollution in and around Seattle, Washington. At the end of the first program year, the AmeriCorps members will be responsible for improving 300 acres of public lands. In addition, the AmeriCorps members will leverage an additional 5,000 community volunteers who will be engaged in activities such as planting trees, removing invasive weeds, and installing and maintaining specially engineered systems that manage stormwater by using plants and soils.

program_name: AmeriCorps Fixed Amount Grant (State) College and Career Coaches Program
program_description: The program aims to improve students' college knowledge, bolster the schools' college-going culture, and increase awareness of the state's College Bound Scholarship program. It also seeks to leverage an additional 100 volunteers to implement activities and speak at college and career workshops and events.
The College and Career Coaches Program aims to improve college knowledge among students and increase the number of engaged students with improved college knowledge.
